ref: 13392 *siṅkā ʻ a partic. kind of grass ʼ. [← Drav. Tam. cīku ʻ broom grass ʼ T. Burrow BSOAS xii 140]
Pk. siṁkā -- f. ʻ root stem of the grass Andropogon muricatus ʼ;
P. sī˜k f. ʻ the grass Anathorium muricatum (scented roots of which are used for making screens) ʼ;
H. sī˜k f. ʻ spiky culm of Andropogon muricatus (of which brooms are made) ʼ.
